title: LAION Round 2: Machine-Readable but Still Not Actionable
content: The OLG Hamburg ruled that machine-readable opt-outs must be machine-actionable, not just intelligible—but it left the definition of standards to ongoing fragmentation.
creator: Paul Keller

title: Openness, Power, and the Paradox of Open Data in the Digital Omnibus
content: The Digital Omnibus goes beyond technical fixes—the EU is finally acknowledging the Paradox of Open. Differentiated charging makes sense. Weakening standard licensing risks fragmentation.
creator: Paul Keller

title: Why Wikimedia Needs a Seat at the Agentic AI Foundation
content: Big Tech is building governance for the agentic AI ecosystem. Wikimedia, representing the digital commons, must have a seat at the table.
creator: Alek Tarkowski

title: 5 + 3 + 3 = 0 transparency
content: Major AI companies are ignoring EU transparency rules on training data—despite signing commitments to comply. The Commission must act.
creator: Zuzanna Warso

title: Open Future Joins Journalistic Investigation into Belgian and Flemish Government AI Spending
content: We're partnering with Apache on a journalistic investigation into how Belgian and Flemish governments are investing in artificial intelligence.
creator: Virginia Díez

title: Eurosky dawns
content: The Eurosky initiative is building European social media infrastructure on the ATProtocol, representing a new step in Europe's digital sovereignty agenda as policymakers seek alternatives to Big Tech platforms that serve public interest rather than commercial imperatives.
creator: Aditya Singh

title: Digital Commons on the EU’s Digital Sovereignty Agenda
content: Digital Commons are moving to the center of Europe’s digital sovereignty agenda, as policymakers look for coordinated ways to fund, govern and scale shared public-interest digital infrastructure.
creator: Zuzanna Warso

title: Open Future Joins the European Network for Technological Resilience and Sovereignty
content: We join ETRS to strengthen Europe's technological resilience and sovereignty through knowledge exchange, strategic analysis of technology dependencies, and evidence-based solutions.
creator: Virginia Díez

title: Open letter calls for EU to use open source AI to strengthen European digital sovereignty
content: This letter calls on EU leaders to harness open source AI as a key enabler of Europe's digital sovereignty and propose a five-point plan.
creator: Virginia Díez

title: GEMA v OpenAI: Memory is Fragile. Garbage Lasts Forever.
content: GEMA's lawsuit against OpenAI has reignited the debate about AI training and copyright. This post examines the relationship between AI training and the TDM exceptions.
creator: Paul Keller
